prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles for the coordinate system should be [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees, and the translation vector should be [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. This will position the sketch appropriately for the desired prism shape. Next, create the 2D sketch for this part on face 1 of the coordinate system. 1. Draw line 1 starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw line 2 starting at [0.75, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.625]. 3. Draw line 3 starting at [0.75, 0.625] and ending at [0.0, 0.625]. 4. Draw line 4 starting at [0.0, 0.625] and ending at [0.0, 0.0]. These four lines create a closed loop that outlines the rectangular prism shape. There is only one loop in this 2D sketch, and it contains 4 lines. Now, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system defined earlier. Now, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to create a 3D prism model. To accomplish this: 1. Set the extrude depth towards the normal direction to be 0.5 units. 2. Set the extrude depth opposite the normal direction to be 0.0 units. This will create a solid rectangular prism in the CAD model. The height, width, and length of the part are as follows: - Height: 0.75 - Width: 0.5 - Length: 0.75 This completes the instructions for the first part of the CAD assembly. Continue with the next part by creating a new coordinate system using the information and instructions provided in the subsequent text.</description>

Draw the second line segment starting at [0.75, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.375]. This line forms the right side of the prism. 3. The shape is now complete. Confidence: 95%</description>
